review_blob: This wonderful beer that smells of bananas and cloves. It is unfiltered and golden yellow in color with a particular taste that resembles a light begian golden ale. Another winner for Lagunitas.

My first interpretation of this beer is a light double or triple belgian golden ale. It smells of bananas and citrus and tastes of light crystal malts and earthy hops. The finish is medium bodied, and crisp or dry.

Kingpin is primarily hop oriented with minor hints of a malty flavor. The aroma is malty and floral, and not as citrusy as I expected. This beer holds to its name as a red amber color, and is worth a center stature suggested by the name.

Pike IPA carries a classic hoppy and floral aroma and appears a beautiful amber color. The flavor is overly malty for a standard IPA but finishes strong with an abundance of hops to satisfy my palate.
Double Take IPA is a well balanced IPA with a good aroma of citrus and malts, dark amber color, and a well rounded flavor. The more I drink the better it seems to taste.

Hop Czar has a wonderful malty tone, swarmed by a dominant hope bitterness. This beer is uncharacteristic of an imperial IPA, bitterness comparing to a regular ipa rather than an imperial. Quite amazing nonetheless.

My first IPA from a can. The aroma smells of citrus and caramel malts; the taste is well bodied, and hoppiful, there are few malty tones. the appearance is golden amber in color and poured an average head.
beer_name: 21st Amendment Brew Free or Die IPA

review_blob: I first expected Radiant to be more hoppy than it turned out to be, most of my expectations deriving from the hoppy aroma. The beer is amber in color, and poured a average head. The flavor lacking to my standards of pale ale hoppyness, the main flavor is a sweet malty toner, with a minimal bitter aftertaste.

This is the first sour beer i have had in a while and Im not too sure on how it rate it. The aroma is sweet, almost fruity. The taste brings a whole new meaning to beer, sour/tart and malty awesomeness with a hoppy resin. The body is light, with a medium carbonation. I am curious of how this beer was made, one of a kind.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Le Terroir

review_blob: Summer Honey smells of light citrus and honey, with a strong aroma of lager yeast and malts. The taste is subtle, most flavor coming from the malts and yeast combination, there is also hints of honey found near the end of the flavor profile. The beer is light in body, with a strong carbonation.

Aroma smells of dark roasted malts, chocolate, and caramel, maybe traces of hops. The taste begins full bodied and malty, and finished with a mellow flavor of bitter hops and chocolate. The appearance is a hazy auburn color.

The subtle hints of ginger, wheat, flowers, make the aroma of this beer one of a kind. Also apparent in the taste, i would define this beer as a spiced witbier, compared to new belgiums mothership wit. Of the two, I like this one BETTER
Im not too sure about the difference between this beer and the original Lucky 13. This is a great beer. An impressive balance of malt and hops, Though i prefer a stronger hoppy flavor.

Mojo smells nutty and hoppy, and appears filtered and amber in color, the moderate hoppy flavor is washed out by the bold malty body. Most of the hop flavor arrives toward the end of the journey, leaving a delightful kick for my palate.

This tame dry-hopped pale ale can be separately characterized from other pale ales due to its sweet-hopped aroma and balanced hop to malt ratio. The flavor seems lacking though, missing a bold hop center
beer_name: Boulder Beer Hazed Hoppy Session Ale

review_blob: For some reason I want to say this beer smells almost organic. The aroma is also sweet, citrusy, and caramely. The appearance is very clear, and golden amber in color. The first thing i noticed from the taste is the alcoholic strength (bad attribute), the enormous amount of hops bring me the smile i most desire with an imperial IPA. Not the best but certainly not the worst.
Sweaty Betty is light yellow and as clear as crystal. The aroma smells of wheat and grass. The taste is best defined as light and sweet with a strong focus of wheat flavor.

Sanctification has a sour aromatic aroma with hints of citrus and champagne yeast. It appears yellow with carbonation similar to champagne. The taste is much lighter than i thought, and is characterized by a light sour flavor followed by a dry hoppy bite. I find this beer very similar to a dry wine.

Aroma is sweet and hoppy, beer appears golden yellow and fitlered with medium carbonation, the taste is fantastic awesome with a sweet mellow hoppy tone followed by a caramel malt finish. Hell, my dad even liked this beer!
This beer first overwhelmed me with flavor and complexity. I really enjoyed the balance of wheat flavor to roasted malt ratio. Another striking lips of faith!
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Dunkelweiss

review_blob: My first impression of this beer was pegged similar to a black IPA, I was definitely wrong. The smell of this black ale is intensely nutty and malty. It appears black-brown and heavily carbonated. The taste is roasty,  malty, and most potently Nut-full. For the 9% abv, I would characterize this as light for this imperial black ale.

The first instinctive attribute of this beer is the fresh hop smell and flavor. the southern hop smells more flowery than north hops, this is also evident in the flavor. This IPA is much smoother than I expected. I could drink another several bottles.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Fresh Hop IPA - Southern Hemisphere

review_blob: WTF ale brought an amazing smell to my nose when I cracked open the bottle. There were hints of citrus, malt, and a sweetness that resembled an imperial ale. The taste was also delicious,  the main flavor was of malt followed by a strong hop after flavor/taste. This beer is medium bodied, and a bit creamy.

Copper Hook Spring Ale instantly brought happiness to almost all my senses. The smell is of nuts and toast and looks of filtered light brown in color. The taste is hoppy and nutty, medium bodied, drinks like liquid gold. Red Hook always knows how to make consistently good beers.

Somersault brings the all the subtle flavors a good summer ale requires. Its aroma is floral and oaty and appears smooth and golden in color. Its taste brings a crisp hoppy tone followed by a lingering oat and citrus finish. This light bodied beer fits perfect for a relaxing day out in the sun.

After battling the cork from the bottle, the Sixth Glass quad instantly filled my nose with a powerful hints of caramel, alcohol, and hops. Its dark amber color and heavy head heed the way to the superb intense flavors in the taste. This beer is full-bodied with a satisfying sweetness and backdrop of what all beer needs, the hops. Well done, Boulevard, well done.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - The Sixth Glass Quadrupel

review_blob: The Spring Reign ale is an interesting flavorful beer. Its aroma can be characterized as floral and hoppy. It looks golden yellow and unfiltered, as well as pouring a light head. First taste resonates a floral flavor followed by a medium bitter sweet hoppy malt finish. The body of this beer is medium with a long astringent finish.

Irish style nut brown ale is well suited for a dark winter night. Its aroma hints of nuts and chocolate. The color is dark brown and filtered. In taste, first flavor is nutty followed by the chocolate and roasted malts. The beer is medium to heavily bodied and drinks well.

This was my first Ethiopian beer. Harar is a cloudy yellow lager with strong smells of bread, yeast, and malt. The taste is relatively plain with a hint of sweetness, it can be characterized as medium bodied, with a full finish.

Ruination IPA smells greatly of citrus hops and earthy tones. Its appearance is golden yellow and filtered. The taste is bold with strong flavors of hops followed by a subtle taste of malty backgrounds. This beer got its point across, "welcome to the wonderful world of hoppy awesomeness beerdom!"

Four+wylld poured a light carbonated head, and appears golden yellow and filtered. It smells of citrus and hints of yeast. The taste is watered down, the main flavors are subtle hops and malted barley.

Four+Hive poured a little head, and is filtered and golden yellow in color. The aroma is absent, no prominent scents stand out. The taste relatively plain, both layers presenting honey flavor. Hops are evident but concealed by malt and honey.

Hurricane Kitty poured a light head. Its appearance is amber and filtered. There was barely any smell, maybe a bit of citrus hops. The taste is average for an IPA, the most prominent flavor being hops finished with a sweet hoppy aftertaste.

Mothers Milk smells of roasted malts and an undefined sweetness I can only presume as milk. Appearance is dark brown/black. The taste is heavy of roasted malts followed by an odd sweetness. The sweetness forces this beer away from others, separating it as one of a kind.
This beer tastes and smells like a lager. Appearance is filtered and amber in color. Taste is a mix of malts and hops followed by a sweet hoppy finish.

Large Strange Triple had a strong white head. First smell reminds me of  lager beer rather than a triple, next flavors are citrus and cloves. The appearance is an orange haze, with good carbonation.  Taste is clearly alcoholic, there is also blends of hops and medium bodied malts. Finally LST presents a creamy sweet finish. This beer was well worth the price.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Long Strange Tripel

review_blob: Highland Ambush poured a strong head, and looks amber red in color. It smells oak aged and of Scottish malts/hops.  The taste is of bitter oak, hops, and malty. This is a better than average Scottish ale.
Elysian bete blanche is a filtered golden yellow color, its aroma smells of sweet malts and of little hops. The taste is magnificent; sweet maltly flavor finished by a little hoppyness.
beer_name: Elysian Bte Blanche Belgian Tripel (2011 and later)

review_blob: This was the first Chatoe Rogue I have had. It was black in color, medium bodied, and tasted of roasted malts. If anything, this beer lacked pronounced taste.

Kellerweis smells of citrus and bananas. It has an unfiltered yellow appearance, and poured a strong head (good carbonation). First taste welcomes much hops along with a wheat and banana flavor. It is light bodied and tastes amazingFor all who read, try this beer.
The Heavy Seas gold ale smells of light malt and a hint of yeast. The color is golden yellow, and poured a light head. The taste is medium bodied, mainly characterized by a malty flavor.

The Czech Pilsner is another gordon biersch classic and should possibly become the staple beer of this brewery. This had to be the best pilsners I have ever had (note that this is one of my least favorite styles of beers).

The gordon biersch hefe was a standard unfiltered, banana and citrus smelling, light bodied typical hefeweizen beer. It can be compared to any other basic hefe, no outstanding flavor separating it from other hefes.
This was a very good light bodied/tasting beer. The color resembles a bright yellow, the aroma was almost nonexistent. The taste can be defined as a good tasting domestic beer.

Deadlift imperial IPA smells greatly of hops and citrus. It is amber in color, much darker than expected in an IPA. The taste is very mellow, a light bodied hop/citrus flavor (amazing for an imperial to taste this balanced, almost water like). This beer hides the kick most imperial IPAs have... simply Im impressed.
Pigs Ear brown ale is a smooth tasting malty ale with a light citrus aftertaste. It is brown in color, with a great malty aroma. Overall this was a decent brown ale beer.
beer_name: Woodstock Inn Pigs Ear Brown Ale

review_blob: Loon Golden Ale poured with a light froth, and is golden yellow in color. The aroma is light malty/yeasty in character. First taste is dry and malty and finished with a strong hopness
Marzen poured golden brown with a light froth, its aroma is of a standard lager, the taste is of a light malt with a finish of yeasty character.

The Alasken Smoked Porter poured almost black in color and carried a light smoky/roasted aroma. First taste brought light roasted malt flavor followed by an overwhelming taste of smoked wood-chips.  This residual smoky taste further remained  the powerful characteristic holding this beer together.
Gale Force IPA smells much lighter in citrus and hops compared to its NW brothers. The flavor seems less hoppy than expected. You could say this beer is all around.... under par.
